data.meanings: name of an idol of the Pagan Arabs. The tribe of Murad was its worshipper. It was in the shape of a lion.M. Asad: As is evident from early sources, these five gods were among the many worshipped by the pre-Islamic Arabs as well (see the book Kitab al-Asnam by Hisham ibn Muhammad al-Kalbi, ed. Ahmad Zaki, Cairo, 1914) Their cult had probably been introduced into Arabia from Syria and Babylonia, where it seems to have existed in early antiquity.
data.sentence: The word تَسْتَغِيثُونَ comes from the root غ و ث and is associated with the meanings: name of an idol of the Pagan Arabs. The tribe of Murad was its worshipper. It was in the shape of a lion.M. Asad: As is evident from early sources, these five gods were among the many worshipped by the pre-Islamic Arabs as well (see the book Kitab al-Asnam by Hisham ibn Muhammad al-Kalbi, ed. Ahmad Zaki, Cairo, 1914) Their cult had probably been introduced into Arabia from Syria and Babylonia, where it seems to have existed in early antiquity.
